results.title: Batman Begins
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2005
results.brief_description: Driven by tragedy, billionaire Bruce Wayne dedicates his life to uncovering and defeating the corruption that plagues his home, Gotham City. Unable to work within the system, he instead creates a new identity, a symbol of fear for the criminal underworld - The Batman.

constellations_other.name: Superhero special effects
constellations_other.description: VFX talent isn't limited to just one studio that makes superhero blockbusters.

constellations_other.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_other.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2005
results.description: Driven by tragedy, billionaire Bruce Wayne dedicates his life to uncovering and defeating the corruption that plagues his home, Gotham City. Unable to work within the system, he instead creates a new identity, a symbol of fear for the criminal underworld - The Batman.

results.title: Bastardy
results.creator_credit: MIFF Premiere Fund and Amiel Courtin-Wilson
results.brief_description: Provocative, funny and profoundly moving, Bastardy is the inspirational story of a self proclaimed Robin Hood of the streets. For Forty years and with infectious humour and optimism, Jack Charles has juggled a life of crime with another successful career- acting

constellations_other.name: Rachel Perkins
constellations_other.description: The moving image has helped tell First Peoples stories through documentary, films and TV shows, with acclaimed director, producer and screenwriter Rachel Perkins contributing significantly to these stories.

results.description: Provocative, funny and profoundly moving, Bastardy is the inspirational story of a self proclaimed Robin Hood of the streets. For Forty years and with infectious humour and optimism, Jack Charles has juggled a life of crime with another successful career- acting

results.title: Basic Instinct
results.creator_credit: Carolco Pictures, TriStar Pictures, Alan Marshall, Terence Marsh, Ellen Mirojnick, Paul Verhoeven, Joe Eszterhas and Al Magliochetti
results.brief_description: A police detective is in charge of the investigation of a brutal murder, in which a beautiful and seductive woman could be involved.

constellations_other.name: Screen story searching
constellations_other.description: Cinema, smartphones and sensuality collide in this intriguing Constellation that takes a distinctly different path.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Carolco Pictures, TriStar Pictures, Alan Marshall, Terence Marsh, Ellen Mirojnick, Paul Verhoeven, Joe Eszterhas and Al Magliochetti
results.description: A police detective is in charge of the investigation of a brutal murder, in which a beautiful and seductive woman could be involved.
description_for_label: A police detective is in charge of the investigation of a brutal murder, in which a beautiful and seductive woman could be involved.

results.title: Barry Lyndon
results.creator_credit: Hawk Films, Peregrine, Warner Bros. Pictures, Stanley Kubrick, Ulla-Britt Söderlund, Milena Canonero and Ken Adam
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1975
results.brief_description: An Irish rogue uses his cunning and wit to work his way up the social classes of 18th century England, transforming himself from the humble Redmond Barry into the noble Barry Lyndon.

constellations_other.name: Painting pictures
constellations_other.description: Painter and photographer Louis Le Prince was inspired to develop the technology to make animated pictures by the circular panoramic paintings of his friends. His films captured everyday life and alluded to his artistic vision for cinema.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Hawk Films, Peregrine, Warner Bros. Pictures, Stanley Kubrick, Ulla-Britt Söderlund, Milena Canonero and Ken Adam
results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 1975
results.description: An Irish rogue uses his cunning and wit to work his way up the social classes of 18th century England, transforming himself from the humble Redmond Barry into the noble Barry Lyndon.
description_for_label: An Irish rogue uses his cunning and wit to work his way up the social classes of 18th century England, transforming himself from the humble Redmond Barry into the noble Barry Lyndon.

results.title: Band of Brothers
results.creator_credit: HBO Films, DreamWorks Television, HBO, DreamWorks Pictures, Stephen Ambrose, Gary Goetzman, Erik Bork, Tony To and Erik Jendresen
results.brief_description: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war.

constellations_other.name: Conflict to cartoons
constellations_other.description: The Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR was a durable, 16mm camera frequently used by combat photographers like Robert Capa during the Spanish Civil War and Australian Neil Davis in the Vietnam War, but this Constellation goes to some much brighter places.

results.creator_credit_for_label: HBO Films, DreamWorks Television, HBO, DreamWorks Pictures, Stephen Ambrose, Gary Goetzman, Erik Bork, Tony To and Erik Jendresen
results.description: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war. As an elite rifle company parachuting into Normandy early on D-Day morning, participants in the Battle of the Bulge, and witness to the horrors of war, the men of Easy knew extraordinary bravery and extraordinary fear - and became the stuff of legend. Based on Stephen E. Ambrose’s acclaimed book of the same name.
description_for_label: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war. As an elite rifle company parachuting into Normandy early on D-Day morning, participants in the Battle of the Bulge, and witness to the horrors of war, the men of Easy knew extraordinary bravery and extraordinary fear - and became the stuff of legend. Based on Stephen E. Ambrose’s acclaimed book of the same name.

results.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
results.brief_description: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

results.description: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages. In the United States, the “Pyjamas” in the title was modified to reflect the American spelling pajamas. This aired in syndication from 1995 to 1997 as a half-hour series, then became a 15-minute show paired with a short-lived 15-minute series The Crayon Box, under a 30-minute block produced by Sachs Family Entertainment titled Bananas in Pajamas & The Crayon Box. Additionally, the characters and a scene from the show were featured in the Kids for Character sequel titled Kids for Character: Choices Count. The pilot episode was Pink Mug.
description_for_label: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages. In the United States, the “Pyjamas” in the title was modified to reflect the American spelling pajamas. This aired in syndication from 1995 to 1997 as a half-hour series, then became a 15-minute show paired with a short-lived 15-minute series The Crayon Box, under a 30-minute block produced by Sachs Family Entertainment titled Bananas in Pajamas & The Crayon Box. Additionally, the characters and a scene from the show were featured in the Kids for Character sequel titled Kids for Character: Choices Count. The pilot episode was Pink Mug.

results.title: Bad Boys
results.creator_credit: Doug Richardson, Bobbie Read, Jim Mulholland, John Vallone, Michael Barrie, Michael Bay, Don Simpson, George Gallo, Jerry Bruckheimer, Sony Pictures, Don Simpson/Jerry Bruckheimer Films and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Marcus Burnett is a hen-pecked family man. Mike Lowry is a foot-loose and fancy free ladies’ man. Both are Miami policemen, and both have 72 hours to reclaim a consignment of drugs stolen from under their station’s nose. To complicate matters, in order to get the assistance of the sole witness to a murder, they have to pretend to be each other.

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Doug Richardson, Bobbie Read, Jim Mulholland, John Vallone, Michael Barrie, Michael Bay, Don Simpson, George Gallo, Jerry Bruckheimer, Sony Pictures, Don Simpson/Jerry Bruckheimer Films and Columbia Pictures

results.title: Backroads
results.brief_description: Phillip Noyce’s Backroads (1977), made in close consultation with Gary Foley, was groundbreaking for tackling racism and giving First Peoples a say in how they were portrayed.

constellations_other.name: Aboriginal History Archive
constellations_other.description: The Aboriginal History Archive at Victoria University, led by Gary Foley, is dedicated to the collection and preservation of First Peoples' stories and cultural material. The political activism of the Black Power movement in the 1970s is intersected with representation of Aboriginal actors on screen.

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

results.description:
Two strangers – one white, one black – steal a car in western NSW and head for the coast. Jack is abrasive, cunning and disparaging about Aborigines. Gary doesn’t really care – he just wants to escape. En route, they pick up Gary’s Uncle Joe, a French hitchhiker and a young woman who’s running away. Their petty crimes escalate as they go, heading towards disaster.

Phillip Noyce’s Backroads (1977), made in close consultation with Gary Foley, was groundbreaking for tackling racism and giving First Peoples a say in how they were portrayed.
description_for_label:
Two strangers – one white, one black – steal a car in western NSW and head for the coast. Jack is abrasive, cunning and disparaging about Aborigines. Gary doesn’t really care – he just wants to escape. En route, they pick up Gary’s Uncle Joe, a French hitchhiker and a young woman who’s running away. Their petty crimes escalate as they go, heading towards disaster.

Phillip Noyce’s Backroads (1977), made in close consultation with Gary Foley, was groundbreaking for tackling racism and giving First Peoples a say in how they were portrayed.

results.title: Back to the Future
results.creator_credit: U-Drive Productions, Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Robert Zemeckis, Lawrence G. Paull, Bob Gale, Neil Canton, Deborah Lynn Scott and Ellen Lichtwardt Goodchild
results.brief_description: Eighties teenager Marty McFly is accidentally sent back in time to 1955, inadvertently disrupting his parents’ first meeting and attracting his mother’s romantic interest. Marty must repair the damage to history by rekindling his parents’ romance and - with the help of his eccentric inventor friend Doc Brown - return to 1985.
results.creator_credit_for_label: U-Drive Productions, Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Robert Zemeckis, Lawrence G. Paull, Bob Gale, Neil Canton, Deborah Lynn Scott and Ellen Lichtwardt Goodchild

results.title: Babyteeth
results.creator_credit: Alex White, Rita Kalnejais, Amelia Gebler, Shannon Murphy, Sherree Phillips, WeirAnderson.com, Spectrum Films, Jan Chapman Films, Screen Australia, Whitefalk Films and Create NSW
results.brief_description: A terminally ill teen upsets her parents when she falls in love with a small-time drug dealer.

constellations_other.name: Brilliant careers (Gillian Armstrong)
constellations_other.description: Gillian Armstrong's feature film debut not only helped launch her own acclaimed career, but those of the actors as well.
